00051 #ifndef RADIO_H
00052 #define RADIO_H
00053 /*============================ INCLUDE =======================================*/

00055 #include <stdbool.h>
00056 #include "hal.h"
00057 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00058 #include "atmega128rfa1_registermap.h"
00059 #else
00060 #include "at86rf230_registermap.h"
00061 #endif

00064 /*============================ MACROS ========================================*/
00065 #define SUPPORTED_PART_NUMBER                   ( 2 )
00066 #define RF230_REVA                              ( 1 )
00067 #define RF230_REVB                              ( 2 )
00068 #define SUPPORTED_MANUFACTURER_ID               ( 31 )
00069 /* RF230 does not support RX_START interrupts in extended mode, but it seems harmless to always enable it. */
00070 /* In non-extended mode this allows RX_START to sample the RF rssi at the end of the preamble */
00071 //#define RF230_SUPPORTED_INTERRUPT_MASK        ( 0x0C )  //disable RX_START
00072 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00073 #define RF230_SUPPORTED_INTERRUPT_MASK          ( 0xFF )
00074 #else
00075 #define RF230_SUPPORTED_INTERRUPT_MASK          ( 0x0F )
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 #define RF230_MIN_CHANNEL                       ( 11 )
00079 #define RF230_MAX_CHANNEL                       ( 26 )
00080 #define RF230_MIN_ED_THRESHOLD                  ( 0 )
00081 #define RF230_MAX_ED_THRESHOLD                  ( 15 )
00082 #define RF230_MAX_TX_FRAME_LENGTH               ( 127 ) /**< 127 Byte PSDU. */
00083 //#define RF230_MAX_PACKET_LEN                    127
00084 
00085 #define TX_PWR_3DBM                             ( 0 )
00086 #define TX_PWR_17_2DBM                          ( 15 )
00087 
00088 #define TX_PWR_MAX                             TX_PWR_3DBM
00089 #define TX_PWR_MIN                             TX_PWR_17_2DBM
00090 #define TX_PWR_UNDEFINED                       (TX_PWR_MIN+1)
00091 
00092 
00093 #define BATTERY_MONITOR_HIGHEST_VOLTAGE         ( 15 )
00094 #define BATTERY_MONITOR_VOLTAGE_UNDER_THRESHOLD ( 0 )
00095 #define BATTERY_MONITOR_HIGH_VOLTAGE            ( 1 )
00096 #define BATTERY_MONITOR_LOW_VOLTAGE             ( 0 )
00097 
00098 #define FTN_CALIBRATION_DONE                    ( 0 )
00099 #define PLL_DCU_CALIBRATION_DONE                ( 0 )
00100 #define PLL_CF_CALIBRATION_DONE                 ( 0 )

00102 #define RC_OSC_REFERENCE_COUNT_MAX  (1.005*F_CPU*31250UL/8000000UL)
00103 #define RC_OSC_REFERENCE_COUNT_MIN  (0.995*F_CPU*31250UL/8000000UL)

00108 /*============================ TYPEDEFS ======================================*/
00109 
00110 /** \brief  This macro defines the start value for the RADIO_* status constants.
00111  *
00112  *          It was chosen to have this macro so that the user can define where
00113  *          the status returned from the TAT starts. This can be useful in a
00114  *          system where numerous drivers are used, and some range of status codes
00115  *          are occupied.
00116  *
00117  *  \see radio_status_t
00118  */
00119 #define RADIO_STATUS_START_VALUE                  ( 0x40 )
00120 
00121 /** \brief  This enumeration defines the possible return values for the TAT API
00122  *          functions.
00123  *
00124  *          These values are defined so that they should not collide with the
00125  *          return/status codes defined in the IEEE 802.15.4 standard.
00126  *
00127  */
00128 typedef enum{
00129     RADIO_SUCCESS = RADIO_STATUS_START_VALUE,  /**< The requested service was performed successfully. */
00130     RADIO_UNSUPPORTED_DEVICE,         /**< The connected device is not an Atmel AT86RF230. */
00131     RADIO_INVALID_ARGUMENT,           /**< One or more of the supplied function arguments are invalid. */
00132     RADIO_TIMED_OUT,                  /**< The requested service timed out. */
00133     RADIO_WRONG_STATE,                /**< The end-user tried to do an invalid state transition. */
00134     RADIO_BUSY_STATE,                 /**< The radio transceiver is busy receiving or transmitting. */
00135     RADIO_STATE_TRANSITION_FAILED,    /**< The requested state transition could not be completed. */
00136     RADIO_CCA_IDLE,                   /**< Channel is clear, available to transmit a new frame. */
00137     RADIO_CCA_BUSY,                   /**< Channel busy. */
00138     RADIO_TRX_BUSY,                   /**< Transceiver is busy receiving or transmitting data. */
00139     RADIO_BAT_LOW,                    /**< Measured battery voltage is lower than voltage threshold. */
00140     RADIO_BAT_OK,                     /**< Measured battery voltage is above the voltage threshold. */
00141     RADIO_CRC_FAILED,                 /**< The CRC failed for the actual frame. */
00142     RADIO_CHANNEL_ACCESS_FAILURE,     /**< The channel access failed during the auto mode. */
00143     RADIO_NO_ACK,                     /**< No acknowledge frame was received. */
00144 }radio_status_t;
00145 
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * \name Transaction status codes
00149  * \{
00150  */
00151 #define TRAC_SUCCESS                0
00152 #define TRAC_SUCCESS_DATA_PENDING   1
00153 #define TRAC_SUCCESS_WAIT_FOR_ACK   2
00154 #define TRAC_CHANNEL_ACCESS_FAILURE 3
00155 #define TRAC_NO_ACK                 5
00156 #define TRAC_INVALID                7
00157 /** \} */
00158 
00159 
00160 /** \brief  This enumeration defines the possible modes available for the
00161  *          Clear Channel Assessment algorithm.
00162  *
00163  *          These constants are extracted from the datasheet.
00164  *
00165  */
00166 typedef enum{
00167 //    CCA_ED                   = 0,    /**< Use energy detection above threshold mode. */ conflicts with atmega128rfa1 mcu definition
00168     CCA_ENERGY_DETECT         = 0,    /**< Use energy detection above threshold mode. */
00169     CCA_CARRIER_SENSE         = 1,    /**< Use carrier sense mode. */
00170     CCA_CARRIER_SENSE_WITH_ED = 2     /**< Use a combination of both energy detection and carrier sense. */
00171 }radio_cca_mode_t;
00172 
00173 
00174 /** \brief  This enumeration defines the possible CLKM speeds.
00175  *
00176  *          These constants are extracted from the RF230 datasheet.
00177  *
00178  */
00179 typedef enum{
00180     CLKM_DISABLED      = 0,
00181     CLKM_1MHZ          = 1,
00182     CLKM_2MHZ          = 2,
00183     CLKM_4MHZ          = 3,
00184     CLKM_8MHZ          = 4,
00185     CLKM_16MHZ         = 5
00186 }radio_clkm_speed_t;
00187 
00188 typedef void (*radio_rx_callback) (uint16_t data);
